summary: The Disclosing Aid Spent to Ensure Relief Act of 2025 (DISASTER Act) mandates that the Director of the Office of Management and Budget annually submit a detailed report to Congress on all federal disaster-related assistance. This report, due with the President's budget submission, will cover obligations, agencies involved, disaster specifics, and spending types (loans, grants, etc.). Its aim is to improve the appropriations process, inform budget requests, and identify opportunities to reduce future disaster expenses. The report will be made public and searchable.
